algorithm_technique: Iterate through each point as a potential center, calculate squared distances to all other points, and use a hashmap to count frequencies of distances. For each distance with count k, add k*(k-1) to the result.
problem_summary_simple: Count tuples of three points (i, j, k) where distance(i, j) equals distance(i, k).
problem_summary_technical: For each point, compute squared Euclidean distances to all other points. Use a hashmap to count distance frequencies. For each distance with frequency k, add k*(k-1) to the total.
key_insights: The problem can be rephrased as finding pairs of points equidistant from a central point.
Squared Euclidean distance is sufficient to avoid floating-point calculations and square roots.
A hashmap is ideal for efficiently counting occurrences of distances.
